intro: Scutellaria minor, commonly known as lesser skullcap, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to North America. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which includes many aromatic plants such as mint and basil. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 centimeters, featuring square stems and opposite leaves with serrated edges. Its small, tubular blue or violet flowers appear in whorls along the stems, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies. Scutellaria minor is often found in moist meadows, woodlands, and along stream banks, where it thrives in partial to full sunlight.
